intro: Microlicia parvula, commonly known as the small-leaved microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is a small shrub characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
